intro: Echinops mildbraedii, commonly known as the Mildbraed's thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that resemble a globe, which are a distinctive feature of the genus Echinops. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of its unique, prickly fruiting bodies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Echinops mildbraedii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
